article: I still remember father spent plenty of time teaching me how to pronounce a word, how to understand something that I saw for the first time and how to be polite to others. And I will never _ one sentence my father used to say to me, "I love you, son. Say you love me, son." _ , I would scream, "I love you, Dad." When I was growing up, I found that I had little in _ with my father gradually. Sometimes we often argued about something sharply and then the argument changed into a _ . I knew there was a gap between us. I didn't _ hearing the words "I love you" from my father the last time. To tell you the truth, I couldn't honestly remember _ I had last said those words to him, either. Now father was in hospital. The doctor said it was _ and he needed an operation at once, _ he wasn't sure whether my father was able to _ it. Everything in my childhood _ There was a _ at the other end and he replied coldly, "Well, I love you, too!" I _ and said, "Dad, I know you love me, and when you are _ , I know you will say what you want to say." Fifteen minutes later my mother called and _ asked, "Paul, is everything OK?" A few weeks later I was working when I received my father's call. "Paul, I love you." I was so _ that my tears rolled down my cheeks. Perhaps both of us _ that this special moment had _ our relationship to a new level. A short while after this special moment, my father finally narrowly _ death following the heart operation. I can't _ that if I didn't take the first _ and Dad did not survive the surgery, what kind of life I would lead now.
